features: 【Easy upgrade speed and storage】2.5' 7mm sizen and SATA 3 6Gb/s interface. Internal SSD with 2.5"" hard drive form factor is capatible most brand computer and increase your system performance.

【Wide Compatibility】Easy to install desktop or notebook and compatible with multiple platforms and brand models.
【Multiple Capacity Options】128GB/256GB/512GB/1TB/2TB multiple capacity SSD options to meet your needs. *Some of the listed capacity is used for formatting and internal performance functions.
【3 year warranty】 Made in Taiwan. Provide 3 year limited warranty and free tenique support.
body.description: Interface : SATA III (6Gb/s) Storage Capacities : 1TB Form Factor : 2.5-inch NAND Components : Triple-Level Cell (TLC) NAND Flash Memory Product Dimensions : 100mm(L)*69.85mm (W)*7.00mm(H) Weight : 35g Environmental Conditions : - Operating Temperature 0°C to 70°C - Storage Temperature -40°C to 85°C Power Consumption(Avg.) : 1.9W Active,0.32W Idle System Compatibility : - Windows 7/8.1/10/11 - Linux kernel 2.4 and later version - Mac OS X 10.8 and later version Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) : 2,000,000 Hours Warranty : 3 years from the date of purchase Max Sequential Read : 540MB/s Max Sequential Write : 510MB/s

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works like it is supposed to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars good upgrade for older systems but not especially quick for gaming
reviews.reviewText: okay, this is a good, inexpensive upgrade for older systems that don't support nvme storage. i used it to upgrade an older touchscreen system that originally had an older hdd. boot times were horrendous on it prior to installing this. after install the laptop was so much quicker to start up and run programs.the original drive was a 500gb as well so this was a great swap. for the price this one seems to be a good choice so far. the speeds on these are not nearly as fast as a pcie slot nvme so i wouldn't recommend it for running modern games but retro or older titles should be fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy & quick diy replacement
reviews.reviewText: I bought this item for my Lap top and replaced the HDD that didn't work anymore. The exchange taking the old one out and put the new one in was very easy to do. The price for 256 Gigs is low now compared to what a SSD cost a few years back.I received the item in only a couple days

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great upgrade for an older system, good price
reviews.reviewText: I used this to replace the 500 GB 5400 RPM hard drive on an old Toshiba C55t laptop. I normally go with the major brand names on hard drives, but this one had a low price and it wasn't for my primary computer so I figured I would give them a chance. The old drive it was replacing had acceptable sequential read/write scores around 100 MB/s, but the random access sustained speeds were an abysmal 1 MB/s. Queue the upgrade.I ran CrystalDiskMark before and after the upgrade. My final scores were a modest 2.5x the original speed for sequential reads, but a 20x-75x improvement on the random access score. Yeah! This computer boots up much more quickly now.For anyone else tackling this and has some experience doing things like this, here's the process I used. I was cloning a Windows 10 drive. First, note that this is a 480 GB drive and the original one was a little larger at 500 GB. This requires some extra work to shrink things down before cloning. I used some open source tools to handle this, but there are probably commercial copy programs that would handle this. The first step was that I shrunk my C: drive by about 30GB using Disk Management. Next, I booted up to GParted and shrunk the C: partition and scooted the hidden partitions after it over into the gap that was left. The end result is 30GB of unallocated space at the end of the drive. Next, I booted a Clonezilla disk to perform the copy, with my new drive in an enclosure. Expert mode has a setting which allows copying to a smaller drive. Other than that, the default settings worked for me. At the end, I put the new drive in the computer and it booted right up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Upgrading an old Laptop
reviews.reviewText: The LinkMore XG500 is ideal for replacing an older laptop computer's 2.5” hard drive. It greatly improved the speed of my 2016 laptop, although, looking at the XG500 SSD critically, it’s not a fast drive. To test it, I connected it to the 12th generation motherboard of my recently upgraded desktop. Its read and write speeds using the CrystalDiskMark testing software were just OK at 558 mb/s for the highest read score and 470 mb/s for the highest write score. As a comparison, the M2 boot drive in the same computer, which itself is not a particularly fast drive, easily surpassed it at 1,841 mb/s read and 953 mb/s write. The LinkMore drive is best suited for exactly the purpose I’ve put it to, boosting the speed of an older laptop and thus giving it new life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very fast for what it is, Just works
reviews.reviewText: I have used this as a secondary game drive for my gaming machine. Game loading times are not significantly impacted vs my NVMe drive (like 1-5 seconds load time difference) and there are no other issues with the drive. This is not a drive that has DRAM cache from what I see in the spec sheet and my hardware forensics software making it a more budget drive. That is fine however as long as it works which at this point in time it still does. Considering I use it every day; I will report back if it breaks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars low end SSD offering comparative speed, excellent for mission non-critical workstation
reviews.reviewText: The tested speed is not as fast as advertised, but it's close enough, since the speed may be affected by other factors. I have attached a test on my 3 years old samsung 860EVO 500G as a side-by-side comparison, this product appears to perform pretty well comparing to a name brand one.Since it is not a name brand one, how long it will last needs some time to prove, but for sure as a replacement to an old mechanic 2.5" hdd in mission non-critical definitely will be an upgrade, with faster speed, lighter, sustain more shocks, etc.

I used this solid state drive to replace an old mechanical drive in my Lenovo R500 laptop. I checked YouTube to find out how to replace the drive. It looked simple, so I ordered this Linkmore SG500 SS drive after wading through the many SS drives available. When I received it, I popped the old drive out. Popped the Linkmore drive into the old drive enclosure. Slid it back into the laptop. Super easy. Then I loaded an Ubuntu CD into the laptop and installed Ubuntu onto the Linkmore drive. Everything went smoothly. And boot up and app responses are now much quicker. Very happy!
Preso in offerta durante il periodo del black friday, fa perfettamente il suo dovere.Come a solito spedizione Amazon eccellente
J’ai utilisé ce SSD pour sa commodité à l’installation mécanique facile et pour sa souplesse et sa rapidité pour les enregistrements des données informatiques

reviews.reviewTitle: ドキドキしながらPCのクローム OKです＾＾
reviews.reviewText: この容量で・・・安い 大丈夫かな？？って＾＾4年前に交換したPCのSSD 容量も125G（少ないね～～(*'Д｀*) 256Gにしようと考えたんですが その倍で この値段 起動時間も早く成りましたから ちょっと心配ですが 2年は持って欲しいですね（ＳＳＤは速いよね～）追伸(￣▽￣;)追加で購入しようとしたら…値上がりしてますま～それでも安いかな 速度は速いね動画再生 即！です問題は 外付けにする場合 相性有るようですから 認識しない事有ります慌てず 外付けケース変えてみてください
